dialogues.DENHAM:
[1]Come on, fellas - you know the deal - we agreed to push Maureen's start date so she could get her teeth fixed. 
[2]Trust me, Bruce and Maureen are gonna steam up the screen - once we get them on the ship. 
[3]The one we've hired to get to the location. 
[4]Yes, I understand that - but fellas, we're not making that film anymore - and I'll tell you why. 
[5]The story has changed, the script has been rewritten. 
[6]Life intervened! I've come into possession of a map. The soul surviving record of an unchartered island, a place that was thought to exist only in myth ... until now! 
[7]I'm talking about a primitive world ... never before seen by man! The ruins of an entire civilisation - the most spectacular thing you've ever seen! That's where I'll shoot my picture! 
[8]Excuse me, boobies? 
[9]What are you - an idiot? You think they asked De Mille to waste his time on nudie shots? No - they respected the film maker, they showed some class! Not that you'd know what that means - you cheap low-life! 
[10]Gimme that - quick! 
[11]Preston, you have a lot to learn about the motion picture business. 
[12]I want the cast and crew on the ship within the hour. 
[13]Tell `em the studio's pressured us into an early departure. 
[14]hat are they gonna do - sue me? They

[21]She pulled out?! 
[22]You said we were shooting in Singapore, right? That's what you told her? 
[23]Goddammit, Preston! All you had to do is look her in the eye and lie. 
[24]I gotta get to a phone ... talk to Harlow's people.

[33]Ma'am, I think you dropped this. 
[34]Vaudeville huh? I worked Vaudeville once... that is a tough audience. If you don't kill them fast, they kill you. 
[35]t was obviously a terrible 
[36]That's awful. Anyway, Ann - may I call you Ann? 
[37]... You wouldn't happen to be a size four by any chance? 
[38]No! Oh God, no! You've got me all wrong. Miss Darrow, please! I'm not that type of person at all! 
[39]I'm someone you can trust, Ann. I'm a movie producer. Believe me, I am on the level, no funny business. Please, sit down - Please ... Please. 
[40]Ann, I want you to imagine a handsome explorer bound for the Far East. 
[41]Singapore. On board ship he meets a mysterious girl. She's beautiful ... she's fragile ... haunted ... 
[42]She can't escape the feeling that forces beyond her control are compelling her down a road from which she cannot draw back. It's as if her whole life has been a prelude to this moment - this fateful meeting that changes everything. And sure enough, against her better judgement - 
[43]Yes!

[45]Why is that? 
[46]So you're interested? 
[47]That's settled then. I don't want to rush you - but we are under some time pressure here. 
[48]Ann? I'm telling you, You're perfect - look at you! You're the saddest girl I ever met ... you're gonna make `em weep, Ann - you're gonna break their hearts! 
[49]Ann! Miss Darrow! Please! I'm offering NHAM fame ... the thrill of a lifetime and a long sea voyage. You wanna read a script? Jack Driscoll's turning in a draft as we speak. 
[50]ure. Why - wait! You know him? 
[51]What a writer, huh? And let me tell you Ann, Jack Driscoll doesn't want just anyone starring in this picture. He said to me, "Carl, somewhere out there is a woman born to play this role ..." And as soon as I saw you, I knew - 
[52]It was always going to be you. 
[53]Not exactly ... it's actually this one over here. 
[54]Don't let appearances deceive you. It's much more spacious on board. 
[55]Is this all of the equipment? This is all of it? We're taking the Bell and Howell? Good. You got all the lenses - you got the two and the six? 
[56]Yes - Get it on board, fellas. Come on. 
[57]Who?

[61]Can we talk about this later. Can't you see we're in the company of a VIP guest? 
[62]Wonderful idea, thank you, Preston. 
[63]Two thousand - it's a deal ... Will you take a cheque?

[66]What's this?

[68]I'm supposed to be making a feature length picture. 
[69]Jack - No - you can't do this to me! I have a beginning but I need a middle and an end! I gotta have something to shoot.

[76]"Two Thousand Dollars" ...

And clinging to life in this savage place, imagine a people untutored in the ways of the civilised world. A people who have dwelt all their lives in the shadow of Fear! In the shadow of ... "Kong"!

dialogues.ANN:
[1]Twenty girls in feather boas prancing around like circus ponies! That's depressing! 
[2]It's a play.

[6]Hey - you're all I've got.

[38]Oh! This old thing! I just - threw it on! 
[39]What does a girl have to do round here to get some breakfast! 
[40]That's alright Mr. Denham, I know who this is ... 
[41]Thrilled to meet you. It's an honour - to be part of this. 
[42]Actually - I am quite familiar with your work. 
[43]Yes, and what I most admire - is the way you have captured the voice of the common people. 
[44]I'm sure you've heard this before, Mr Driscoll, if you don't mind me saying - you don't look at all like your photograph ... 
[45]Well, he's so much younger - in person. And much better looking. 
[46]I was afraid you might be one of those self obsessed literary types. You know - the tweedy twerp with his nose in a book and his head up his - 
[47]I think this is awfully exciting! I've never been on a ship before. 
[48]I guess you don't think much of women on ships, do you? 
[49]Well, I'll try not to be. 
[50]Well! Is that a nice thing to say!

dialogues.ENGLEHORN:
[1]I cannot do that ... we're waiting on the manifest. 
[2]Paperwork, Mr. Denham. 
[3]You haven't given me the first thousand yet. 
[4]Ma'am... 
[5]So you are ready for this voyage, Miss Darrow? 
[6]Nervous? 
[7]It isn't every woman who would take such a risk. 
[8]Do I have a choice? 
[9]Dead slow ahead both, Mr Hayes. 
[10]Choy! 
[11]My apologies for not being able to offer you a cabin. Have you found an enclosure to your taste? 
[12]What are you, Mr. Driscoll, a lion or a chimpanzee? 
[13]I told you to lock it up. 
[14]Lumpy doesn't give the orders. What are you trying to do? Put the whole ship to sleep? Get them out of here! 
[15]There's no land south-west for thousands of miles. It takes us way outside the shipping lanes. 
[16]I won't sail blind in these waters. 
[17]There's nothing out there. 
[18]Outside! 
[19]There's a warrant out for your arrest. Did you know that? I've been ordered to divert to Rangoon.

[27]20 degrees starboard! 
[28]Get me another reading! 
[29]Douse the lights! 
[30]Stop engines! 
[31]Give me some power! Half astern, both! 
[32]Take the wheel, Hayes! 
[33]Full ahead! 
[34]Hayes! 
[35]What about the prop?

[37]Seen enough? 
[38]Lighten the ship! Anything that's not bolted down goes overboard! 
[39]Wheel amidship ... Full ahead, both engines. 
[40]What in God's name was that? 
[41]You can take Hayes and fifteen others. I'll put a guard on the gate until you return ... The rest of you, stay with the ship. 
[42]You got guns, you got food, you got ammo. You got twenty-four hours. 
[43]This time tomorrow we haul anchor. 
[44]Don't thank God, thank Mr. Baxter ... 
[45]He insisted on a rescue mission. Me? I knew you'd be okay ... 
[46]That's the thing about cockroaches; no matter how many times you flush them down the toilet they always crawl back up the bowl! 
[47]Driscoll ... don't be a fool! Give it up, it's useless ... She's dead. 
[48]You want to trap the Ape? I don't think so. 
[49]Now!!!

[51]Get her out of here! Get her out of his sight! 
[52]Kill it!

[54]Shoot it!!!

[56]Row! Get the hell out of here! 
[57]Hold her!

[8]You gotta straighten up. You don't want to be on this ship for the rest of your life.

[15]Why don't I show Miss Darrow to her cabin? 
[16]Miss Darrow, if you'd just - Hi, my name is Preston, Carl's assistant. 
[17]Please, follow me. If there's anything that you need ... `excuse me fellas, if there's anything that you need please don't hesitate to ... ask ... 
[18]Your cabin's just down here, Mr. Baxter. May I say how excited we are to have you back with us, Sir. 
[19]Let me get the door for you - welcome to your state room sir. 
[20]I hope you find it to your liking... it's quite comfortable. Your towels and linens are underneath the bed. That is the wash basin. I know, that's not a pleasant smell - is it? I'm sure it'll disperse in a day or two. 
[21]The closet ... your costumes - I hope you'll find everything is in order. If there is anything that you need, please do not hesitate to ask...fresh water, perhaps? I can bring it to you personally. 
[22]They're still trying to find a place for him to sleep. 
[23]Isn't that one of Maureen's costumes? 
[24]What do you mean? 
[25]Why did they build the wall? 
[26]What else did he say? 
[27]It's deserted ... 
[28]What about Mike? He didn't get away - he's still there! 
[29]It's not your fault. What happened to Herb - it's no ones fault. 
[30]Drop the bridge! Do it now, for chrissakes! 
[31]No Carl ... 
[32]He was right ... 
[33]... about there still being some mystery left in this world ... 
[34]And we can all have a piece of it ... for the price of an admission ticket. 
[35]I've no idea. I heard he offered her all kinds of money and she turned him down flat.
dialogues.JIMMY:
[1]Compliments of the chef - 
[2]Lambs brains in walnut sauce. 
[3]Doing it now, Mr. Hayes. 
[4]I do. 
[5]I do, Mr. Hayes, I do! Look, I've been readin'. 
[6]I borrowed it ... 
[7]... on long term loan. Look at this. 
[8]"Adventures on a Tramp Steamer". See - just like us. 
[9]No. You're looking for something else ... 
[10]Wall! There's a wall ahead!!! 
[11]Rocks to starboard ... to port ... rocks everywhere! 
[12]Captain! You'd better come up quick! 
[13]Why does Marlow keep going up the river, why doesn't he turn back? 
[14]It's not an adventure story - is it, Mr. Hayes. 
[15]She went to her cabin. 
[16]Com'on Mr. Hayes, look at `em. None of them knows a which way to point a gun. 
[17]Miss Darrow needs me! 
[18]Just keep walking, Mr. Hayes. Pretend you didn't see me. 
[19]Hey! I need that! 
[20]You were younger than me when they gave you one! 
[21]Is that what took Miss Darrow? 
[22]So? We gotta find Miss Darrow. 
[23]Mr. Hayes ...? 
[24]I'm not a coward - I ain't gonna run. 
[25]I ain't gonna run. 
[26]No! Let him go! Kill him! Kill him! 
[27]Bring him down! Mr Hayes! 
[28]No!
dialogues.BRUCE:
[1]Be a sport and lend us a hand. 
[2]Appreciate the help, fella. 
[3]I've never been on one with a woman before. 
[4]No, they're a nuisance. 
[5]Just being around is trouble. 
[6]It's a dangerous thing, having girls on ships. They're messy and they're unreliable! 
[7]beefed up the banter ... 
[8]It's just a little humor, Bud - what are you, a Bolshevik or something? 
[9]Twenty-four hours? 
[10]What?! 
[11]What the hell kind of place is this? Are you sure about this, Denham??? Don't we have a stand-in for this type of thing? 
[12]Nobody's gonna think these are fake! 
[13]I'm not moving. 
[14]Mother of God ... 
[15]He's - he's ... um ... well, he's up there ... filming. 
[16]We gotta get back to the ship. Englehorn sails in nine hours. 
[17]Hey, did you hear me? We're gonna be stranded here! 
[18]Miss Darrow was a great gal - no question. She was a wonderful person. It's a terrible loss. We're all gonna miss her. 
[19]Hey, pal, wake up. Heroes don't look like me - not in the real world. In the real world they've got bad teeth, a bald spot and a beer gut ... be seeing ya. 
[20]Well to be honest with you, I had some anxious moments ... 
[21]For a while there it looked like I wasn't going to get paid ... But as it turned out, Mr. Denham here has been more than generous -

dialogues.LUMPY:
[1]Fancy some of me ... ah ... Porridge aux walnuts? 
[2]I would say they was full of it, Mr. Hayes. We turned south-west last night. 
[3]I wouldn't be so sure of that. 
[4]Seven years ago, me and Mr Hayes - we were working our passage on a Norwegian barque. 
[5]His ship had run aground on an island, way West of Sumatra. An island hidden in fog. He spoke of a huge wall, built so long ago - no one knew who had made it ... A wall a hundred foot high ... as strong today as it was, ages ago. 
[6]The castaway - he spoke of a creature, neither beast nor man, but something monstrous, living behind that wall... 
[7]Nothing. We found him the next morning ... he'd stuck a knife through his heart. 
[8]Christ! It's a bleeding bone yard! They've been ripped limb from limb. 
[9]I'm knackered! I've gotta have a breather. 
[10]Bloody Nora! 
[11]There's only one creature capable of leaving a footprint that size ... 
[12]The abominable snowman! 
[13]Injured? Four of us are dead!
dialogues.MANNY:
[1]Who wrote it, Annie? 
[2]The trick is to start the build right at the back of your throat... Works well out through the nose too. 
[3]Oh, I'm not hungry. Don't worry about me. 
[4]You think the kitchen'll still be open on Third? 
[5]Ann ... Annie! It's no use. 
[6]I'm sorry, Ann. Ever since you were small people have been letting you down. But you gotta think of yourself now. You should try out for that part. 
[7]It's what you've always wanted. Oh, I know what you're thinking - every time you reach out for something you care about ... fate comes along and snatches it away. 
[8]But not this time, Annie ... not this time.
dialogues.ZELMAN:
[1]How much more is there? 
[2]Lights up. 
[3]What location? Carl - you're supposed to be shooting on the back-lot. 
[4]Whoa! Carl - slow down! 
[5]Would you step outside for a moment, Carl? 
[6]Don't write him off fellas. He's hot- headed sure, but Carl Denham's made some interesting pictures, he's had a lot of ... near success. 
[7]The animal footage has value? 
[8]Get him back in.
dialogues.SLEAZY INVESTOR:
[1]Is he askin' for more money? 
[2]Will there be boobies? 
[3]Jigglies, jablongers, bazoomers! ... In my experience people only go to these films to observe the ... undraped form of the native girls. 
[4]He can't direct. He doesn't have the smarts. 
[5]Sure ... Universal are desperate for stock footage. 
[6]Get out of there! 
[7]You're finished, Denham! 
[8]No, no, no!
dialogues.RESTON:
[1]o Carl, you can't do this! 
[2]ou realize none of the camera 
[3]We have no insurance, no foreign currency - in fact, we have no currency of any kind - 
[4]Maureen pulled out. 
[5]Yesterday. I told you. 
[6]Carl! 
[7]know, that's not a nice smell is it? 
[8]Yes - he didn't take it well.
dialogues.WESTON:
[1]Oh, Jeez ... 
[2]Look, Miss ... I told you already; call my office - leave your resume with my secretary. 
[3]Because that's what a smart girl would do. 
[4]What can I say? Jack Driscoll's very particular about who he works with. 
[5]esus - you don't give up, do you? 
[6]Look - I know times are tough. You want my advice? Use what you got. You're not bad looking - a girl like you doesn't have to starve. 
[7]There's a new place, just opened. Listen, princess - this gig ain't the Palace, you understand? Ask for Kenny K. Tell him I sent you.
dialogues.ACK:
[1]I know - but they're good! You've got fifteen good pages there, Carl! 
[2]I've never known you to volunteer cash before ... 
[3]No, it's okay. 
[4]Miss Darrow ... 
[5]Hang on to me! 
[6]Carl! 
[7]Jimmy! No!
dialogues.THELMA:
[1]Tell me everything - every little detail! 
[2]French, huh? 
[3]He clutches your hand?! 
[4]And that's when he told you how he felt? 
[5]He never said it?! 
[6]Then how does she know that it's real? 
[7]Please - if you feel it, you say it. It's really very simple.
dialogues.THUGGISH INVESTOR:
[1]This is it? This is what we get for our forty grand, Denham? Another one of your Safari pictures? 
[2]It's not the principle of the thing - it's the money. 
[3]He's a preening self promoter ... 
[4]... an ambitious no-talent! The guy has "loser" written all over him. 
[5]This jumped up little turd's gonna bankrupt us. 
[6]Then sell it! Scrap the picture! We gotta retrieve something from this debacle.
dialogues.CHOY:
[1]This room very comfortable, plenty dim light ... fresh straw. 
[2]Lion, tiger, hippo - you name it. What, do you sell them to Zoos? 
[3]Zoos ... circus ... Skipper get big money for rare animal. Careful! Camel have bad accident on floor. Stain unremovable ... 
[4]Skipper catch any animal you want. He do you real good price on rhite wino. 
[5]Sorry, Skipper! Lumpy said - 
[6]Lumpy! Help me!
dialogues.HERB:
[1]Delighted to meet you, ma'am. And may I say what a lovely dress. 
[2]Hear! Hear! 
[3]You wanna go with the six inch lens? 
[4]Mr Denham ... ! Take the tripod. 
[5]You gotta go!! 
[6]You gotta leave me!
dialogues.JAYNE:
[1]So, he took me to a fancy French restaurant ... 
[2]Anyway about half way through the whore derves - he clutches my hand ... 
[3]He's looking into my eyes - 
[4]No - he never said it. 
[5]He said it was not about the words. 
[6]He said we'd talk about it later. Only there was no later ...
